citation.article-title: Bacillus salexigens sp. nov., a new moderately halophilic Bacillus species.

p.s: Description of Bacillus salexigens Garabito, Arahal, Mellado, Marquez, and Ventosa sp. nov.
Bacillus salexigens (sal.ex'i. gens. L. n. sal, salt; L. v. exigu, to demand; M. L. part. adj. salexigens, salt demanding)
Gram-positive rods that are 0.3 to 0.6 by 1.5 to 3.5 μm and occur singly, in pairs, or in short chains.
Motile.
Oval endospores are produced at subterminal or central positions in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are nonpigmented, circular, smooth, convex, and entire.
Growth occurs in the presence of 7 to 20% (wt/vol) total salts, and optimal growth occurs in the presence of 10% (wt/vol) total salts.
No growth occurs in the absence of salts.
Growth occurs at temperatures between 15 and 45°C (optimal temperature, 37°C) and at pH values between 6.0 and 11.0 (optimal pH, 7.5).
Strictly aerobic.
Catalase and oxidase are produced.
Acid is produced from D-glucose, D-fructose, maltose, D-mannitol, glycerol, and D-mannose.
Acid is not produced from dulcitol, D-galactose, D-melibiose, lactose, D-trehalose, D-xylose, and Lrhamnose.
DNA is hydrolyzed; starch, Tween 80, and tyrosine are not hydrolyzed.
Indole, Voges-Proskauer, Simmons citrate, phenylalanine deaminase, arginine dihydrolase, and lysine and ornithine decarboxylase tests are negative.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: pyruvic acid, D-xylose, dextrin, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, cellobiose, D-fructose, D-glucose, maltose, maltotriose, D-mannose, D-psicose, D-ribose, salicin, turanose, L-lactic acid, N-acetyl-glutamate, glycyl-L-glutamic acid, L-alanyl-glycine, glycerol, adenosine, 2’-deoxyadenosine, inosine, thymidine, and uridine.
p-Hydroxyphenylacetic acid and succinic acid are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.
Susceptible to chloramphenicol, carbenicillin, rifampin, novobiocin, cephalothin, penicillin G, and ampicillin.
Resistant to nalidixic acid and polymyxin.
Other phenotypic features are shown in Table 1.
The DNA base composition ranges from 36.3 to 39.5 mol%, as determined by the thermal denaturation method.
The cell wall contains peptidoglycan of the meso-diaminopimelic acid type.
The habitats are solar salterns and saline soils.
The type strain is strain C-20Mo (= ATCC 700290 = DSM 11483 = CCM 4646).
Description of the type strain.
The description of the type strain is the same of that of the species, except that the type strain grows in the presence of 10 to 20% (wt/vol) total salt and does not produce acid from D-mannitol.
The base composition of its DNA is 39.5 mol%, as determined by the thermal denaturation method.
